android.gameengine.icadroids.dashboard

Class DashboardTextView

  • java.lang.Object
    • TextView
      • android.gameengine.icadroids.dashboard.DashboardTextView

  • public class DashboardTextView
extends TextView
    An extension of the default Android TextView class (see http://developer.android.com/reference/android/widget/TextView.html) for use as a dashboard widget. Interesting methods include setText(String text), setTextColor(int textColor) and setTextSize(int unit, float size). Unit for text size can be one of: - TypedValue.COMPLEX_UNIT_DIP : device independent pixels - TypedValue.COMPLEX_UNIT_PT : points - TypedValue.COMPLEX_UNIT_PX : pixels
    Author:
    Matthijs de Jonge

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run(java.lang.Runnable runnable)
        Execute a piece of code, presumably something that has to do with this dashboard widget. This is the only way to perform actions on a dashboard widget. Some widget methods, such as setting the color, can be called directly but most can't, especially if they cause the widget to be redrawn in its entirety, such as text changes or position changes.
        Parameters:
        runnable - the runnable to execute

      • setTextString

        public void setTextString(java.lang.String textString)
        Set the text to be displayed in this widget.
        Parameters:
        textString - the text to display

      • setWidgetWidth

        public void setWidgetWidth(int width)
        Set the width of the widget (in pixels). If you don't use this method, the widget will take up as much space as it needs.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the widget

      • setWidgetHeight

        public void setWidgetHeight(int height)
        Set the height of the widget (in pixels). If you don't use this method, the widget will take up as much space as it needs.
        Parameters:
        height - the height of the widget

      • setWidgetBackgroundColor

        public void setWidgetBackgroundColor(int color)
        Set the background color for the widget. Use the Android Color class to determine the values to use (see http://developer.android.com/reference/android/graphics/Color.html)
        Parameters:
        color - the background color to use
